result.title: Got wrong answer at Test 6 on 13C(Sequence)
result.content:
I try to solve the problem of 13C, but get a wrong answer at test 6.Here is my source code for this question:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

#define MIN(a, b) ((a) < (b) ? (a) : (b))
#define ABS(v) ((v) > 0 ? (v) : -(v))

long long row_arr[5002] = {0};
long long ans_arr[5002] = {0};
int input_arr[5002] = {0};
int order_arr[5002] = {0};
int compare(const void* a, const void* b)
{
	return (*(int *)a - *(int* )b);
}

int main()
{
	int n, i, j, min;
	//freopen("a.txt", "r", stdin);
	scanf("%d", &n);
	for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
	{
		scanf("%d", &input_arr[i]);
		order_arr[i] = input_arr[i];
	}
	qsort(order_arr, n, sizeof(int), compare);
	row_arr[0] = ABS(input_arr[0] - order_arr[0]);
	for(i = 1; i < n; i++)
		row_arr[i] = MIN(row_arr[i - 1], ABS(input_arr[0] - order_arr[i]));
	for(i = 1; i < n; i++)
	{
		ans_arr[0] = row_arr[0] + ABS(input_arr[i] - order_arr[0]);
		for(j = 1; j < n; j++)
			ans_arr[j] = MIN(ans_arr[j - 1], row_arr[j] + ABS(input_arr[i] - order_arr[j]));
		for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
			row_arr[j] = ans_arr[j];
	}

	min = ans_arr[n - 1];
	printf("%d\n", min);
	return 0;
}

This problem has puzzled me for a long time and I really need to get someone's help to solve this problem. Thx
